instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A2179: What is A2179? A2179 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2020 with EMC 3302, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01958..
definitions.SYS_DETECT_L: What is SYS_DETECT_L? For detection of the battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery not charging, fans run at max
threads.message:
Hi there,

got a MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) with unknown history but looking clean so far. The Macbook turns on but fan speen increases up to max and it is incredibly slow. Additionally the battery is not correctly recognized (Warning symbol on battery symbol) or charging or running from battery only.
Already tried a known good battery and repairing in DFU mode.
Unforunately I dont know much about the behavior of the Typ-C MacBook Air models and owuld be happy for some help.

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery not charging, fans run at max
threads.message:
Unrecognized battery can cause this.
Did you try known good battery, or "new chinese" one?

Check voltage and diode mode on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus; in front and behind <TRANSISTOR>Q6950</TRANSISTOR>.

Be sure <SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> is correctly pulled down.
Did you connect battery data flex and correctly tighten the big screw?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery not charging, fans run at max
threads.message:
Yes, you were right again ? My OEM testing battery did get faulty. 

Now I have another issue with the keyboard backlight. It's always on and not dimmable. Even if MBA is off. Only turns off if I close the lid.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery not charging, fans run at max
threads.message: Check if backlight screen reacts when direct flashlight to webcam (ALS).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery not charging, fans run at max
threads.message: It does - ALS seems to be good ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery not charging, fans run at max
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery not charging, fans run at max
threads.message: yes, PRAM, NVRAM and SMC reset done.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery not charging, fans run at max
threads.message:
Try DFU revive, just in case.
If no important data, try restore and macOS fresh installation.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery not charging, fans run at max
threads.message: Also restored it already and did a clean install ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery not charging, fans run at max
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery not charging, fans run at max
threads.message: Replacing <CHIP>U6550</CHIP> solved the problem ?? Thank you very much!
